title: The First Big Elections of the New Trump Era Are Today. Here’s What to Look For.
summary: The mayor’s race in New York will gauge voters’ desire for a left-wing shift, and Democrats running for governor in New Jersey and Virginia again made fighting the president central to their bids.

title: Dick Cheney, Powerful Vice President and Washington Insider, Dies at 84
summary: A former defense secretary and congressman, he held the nation’s No. 2 job under President George W. Bush and was an architect of policies in an era of war and economic change.

title: Trump Doubles Down on Nuclear Tests. His Energy Secretary Differs.
summary: President Trump and one of his top cabinet officials are sending mixed messages on how the U.S. government is handling the most destructive weapons in the world.

title: The Battle Over an Activist Who Protested Stephen Miller Near His Virginia Home
summary: Criminal inquiries pit the Miller family’s safety concerns against the First Amendment rights of an activist in Northern Virginia critical of the administration.

title: New Pentagon Press Crew Is All In on Trump
summary: The Defense Department’s new press policy led to an exodus of traditional journalists. Supporters of the president have stepped in.

title: Trump’s Tariffs and Push Against Limits Face Election and Court Tests
summary: President Trump has a lot riding on the results of Tuesday’s elections, his tariffs case at the Supreme Court and the future of the government shutdown.

title: The Workers Left Out of Trump’s Drug-Manufacturing Renaissance
summary: President Trump wants pharmaceutical production to return to the United States. A shuttered factory in Louisiana shows how hard that will be for generic medicines.

title: She Voted for Trump Three Times. Now She Is Leading a Fight Against His Tariffs.
summary: The Liberty Justice Center led by Sara Albrecht is better known for backing right-leaning causes, but it filed the tariff case that will be heard by the Supreme Court this week.

title: This Trillionaire Economy Thrived in a Global Order Trump Is Ditching
summary: Poland and other countries across Europe that found economic success in an era of collaboration are now facing a crumbling of international alliances.

title: In Search of the Simpsonville Massacre
summary: In 1865, two dozen Union soldiers, all formerly enslaved, were ambushed and killed along a road in Kentucky. Archaeologists are still searching for their remains.

title: Amazon Oil Drilling Undermines Brazil’s Climate Credibility Before COP30
summary: Brazil, which is hosting the 30th U.N. Climate Change Conference this month, wants to show the world it is a leader in safeguarding the planet. Its record tells a more complicated story.

title: A Storm Hit Alaska. Now, a Native Community Is Racing to Save Its History.
summary: The remnants of Typhoon Halong scattered artifacts from an archaeological site along the shore of the Bering Sea.

title: Capitalism Is Constantly Reinventing Itself. That’s Why Things Feel So Volatile.
summary: We are in the middle of the capitalistic order reinventing itself.

title: Nick Fuentes Is Becoming Charlie Kirk’s Successor
summary: A white nationalist’s rise reveals a seemingly unstoppable ratchet of radicalization on the right.

title: Late Night Finds Trump’s Rich ‘Great Gatsby’ Party in Poor Taste
summary: “There were dancers, costumes and champagne — a wonderful celebration where the theme was apparently gross income inequality,” Jon Stewart said.

title: As UK Tries to Curb Immigration, Rural Scotland Looks to Attract Foreign Workers
summary: Bucking the anti-immigration trend in British politics, remote areas of Scotland would like to attract foreign workers to offset declining local populations.

title: After Hurricane Melissa, a Seaside Town in Jamaica Picks Up the Pieces
summary: The devastation caused by Hurricane Melissa in Black River, Jamaica, reflects the broader destruction and rebuilding facing many Jamaican communities.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actress and Mother of Laura Dern, Dies at 89
summary: She was a three-time Oscar contender playing strikingly different characters, in one case starring alongside her daughter and fellow nominee, Laura Dern.

title: G.O.P. Figures Seek Distance From Tucker Carlson, Denouncing Antisemitism
summary: Prominent Republicans rejected the views of Nick Fuentes, a white supremacist, though some refrained from directly criticizing Tucker Carlson for interviewing him.
